---
title: "Log Roll (Hip) Test"
---


# Technique


- Supine
- 0&deg; Hip and knee extension
- Passively rotate the hip in IR and ER @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020
- Compare differences between Left versus Right hips

::: {.callout-note}
Ensure the rotation is happening at the hip and *not* the knee or ankle @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020
:::

# Findings


"The test is positive for ligamentous laxity when the involved hip demonstrates greater external rotation ROM and the uninvolved hip or reproduces anterior pain.22" @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020

# Reliability

For patients with non-arthritic intra-articular hip pathologies, the inter-rater reliability of the clinicians demonstrated 80% agreement and &kappa;=0.61 (95% CI: 0.48, 0.84) @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020
